question: Who was Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel?
explanation: Georg Wilhelm Friedrich Hegel (27 August 1770 â€“ 14 November 1831) was a German philosopher and an important figure in German idealism. He is considered one of the fundamental figures of modern Western philosophy, with his influence extending to the entire range of contemporary philosophical issues, from aesthetics to ontology to politics, both in the analytic and continental tradition. Hegel's principal achievement was his development of a distinctive articulation of idealism, sometimes termed absolute idealism, in which the dualisms of, for instance, mind and nature and subject and object are overcome.
